formalpara.title: Figure 1. A canonical Wnt signaling pathway
formalpara.para: In the absence of signal, action of the destruction complex (CKIα, GSK3β, APC, Axin) creates a hyperphosphorylated β-catenin, which is a target for ubiqitination and degradation by the proteosome. Binding of Wnt ligand to a Frizzled/LRP-5/6 receptor complex leads to stabilization of hypophosphorylated β-catenin, which interacts with TCF/LEF proteins in the nucleus to activate transcription. In a canonical pathway, CKIα, GSK3β, APC, and Axin act as negative regulators and all other components act positively.
